explanation: The report is correct. The while loop condition assigns ro = va_arg(...) and only enters the loop body when ro != MHD_RO_END. Therefore any code within the loop guarded by case MHD_RO_END: cannot be reached at runtime. That case label is unreachable (the comment even says "Not possible"). MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code, so this case label constitutes a violation. (Fixes: remove the unreachable case, or rewrite the loop to make the end marker handled inside the switch, e.g. use a do/while and test after the switch.)
